title: Kshetra Kshetrajna Vibhaga Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Discrimination Between the Field and the Knower of the Field
summary: In this profound chapter, Krishna explains the distinction between the physical body (kshetra/field) and the soul (kshetrajna/knower of the field). He describes 24 elements that constitute the field of material nature, then reveals the supreme knowledge that leads to liberation - understanding the difference between these material elements and the conscious soul. Krishna explains that the Supreme Soul (Paramatma) pervades all fields as the witness, sustainer, and ultimate knower. The chapter concludes by describing how one who perceives the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings attains the highest spiritual vision.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च | एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva kṣetraṃ kṣetra-jñam eva ca | etad veditum icchāmi jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ ca keśava ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Kesava, I wish to learn about prakriti (nature) and purusha (the enjoyer), the field and the knower of the field, knowledge and that which ought to be known.
verses.explanation: Arjuna requests Krishna to explain the distinction between matter and spirit.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते | एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetram ity abhidhīyate | etad yo vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetra-jña iti tad-vidaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O son of Kunti, this body is called the field (kshetra), and one who knows this body is called the knower of the field (kshetrajna) by those who know of them.
verses.explanation: Krishna defines the body as the field and the soul as its knower.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ||
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-jñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi sarva-kṣetreṣu bhārata | kṣetra-kṣetra-jñayor jñānaṃ yat taj jñānaṃ mataṃ mama ||
verses.translation: O scion of Bharata, understand that I am the knower in all fields. Knowledge of both the field and the knower of the field—that I consider true knowledge.
verses.explanation: Krishna reveals Himself as the supreme knower in all bodies.

verses.sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् | स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||
verses.transliteration: tat kṣetraṃ yac ca yādṛk ca yad-vikāri yataś ca yat | sa ca yo yat-prabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu ||
verses.translation: Hear briefly from Me what the field is, what its nature is, what its modifications are, whence it arises, who the knower is, and what his powers are.
verses.explanation: Krishna prepares to explain the field's characteristics.

verses.sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् | ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṃ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak | brahma-sūtra-padaiś caiva hetumadbhir viniścitaiḥ ||
verses.translation: This knowledge has been sung by sages in various ways, in different Vedic hymns, and also in the conclusive and convincing statements of the Brahma-sutras.
verses.explanation: This wisdom has been expressed in various scriptures.

verses.sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च | इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः || इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः | एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ||
verses.transliteration: mahā-bhūtāny ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca | indriyāṇi daśaikaṃ ca pañca cendriya-gocarāḥ || icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṅghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ | etat kṣetraṃ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛtam ||
verses.translation: The five great elements, false ego, intelligence, the unmanifest, the ten senses, the mind, the five sense objects, desire, hatred, happiness, distress, the aggregate, life symptoms, and convictions—all these are considered, in summary, to be the field and its interactions.
verses.explanation: The 24 elements constituting the field (material nature).

verses.sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् | आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः || इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च | जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् || असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु | नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु || मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी | विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि || अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् | एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ||
verses.transliteration: amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṃsā kṣāntir ārjavam | ācāryopāsanaṃ śaucaṃ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ || indriyārtheṣu vairāgyam anahaṅkāra eva ca | janma-mṛtyu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣānudarśanam || asaktir anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛhādiṣu | nityaṃ ca sama-cittatvam iṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu || mayi cānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī | vivikta-deśa-sevitvam aratir jana-saṃsadi || adhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṃ tattva-jñānārtha-darśanam | etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṃ yad ato 'nyathā ||
verses.translation: Humility, pridelessness, nonviolence, tolerance, simplicity, approaching a genuine spiritual teacher, cleanliness, steadiness, self-control, renunciation of sense objects, absence of false ego, perception of the evil in birth, death, old age and disease, detachment, freedom from entanglement with children, wife, home and the rest, even-mindedness amid pleasant and unpleasant events, constant and unalloyed devotion to Me, resorting to solitary places, detachment from the general mass of people, accepting the importance of self-realization, and philosophical search for the Absolute Truth—all these I declare to be knowledge, and what is contrary to this is ignorance.
verses.explanation: The 20 qualities that constitute true knowledge leading to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते | अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: jñeyaṃ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛtam aśnute | anādi mat-paraṃ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate ||
verses.translation: I shall now explain the knowable, knowing which one attains immortality. The supreme Brahman is beginningless, subordinate to Me, and is said to be neither being nor non-being.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the nature of the supreme knowable (Brahman).

verses.sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् | सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ||
verses.transliteration: sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṃ tat sarvato 'kṣi-śiro-mukham | sarvataḥ śrutimal loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati ||
verses.translation: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads and mouths everywhere, with ears everywhere, That exists in the world, enveloping all.
verses.explanation: The all-pervading nature of the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् | असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-indriya-guṇābhāsaṃ sarva-indriya-vivarjitam | asaktaṃ sarva-bhṛc caiva nirguṇaṃ guṇa-bhoktṛ ca ||
verses.translation: It appears to have the qualities of all senses yet is without any senses; unattached, yet supporting all; without qualities, yet perceiving all qualities.
verses.explanation: The transcendental nature of the Supreme that is beyond material qualities.

verses.sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च | सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ||
verses.transliteration: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṃ caram eva ca | sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṃ dūra-sthaṃ cāntike ca tat ||
verses.translation: It is inside and outside all beings, moving and unmoving. It is inconceivable because of its subtlety. It is far away yet very near.
verses.explanation: The simultaneous immanence and transcendence of the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् | भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||
verses.transliteration: avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam | bhūta-bhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca ||
verses.translation: Although appearing divided among beings, the knowable remains undivided. It is to be known as the sustainer of beings, the devourer and the creator.
verses.explanation: The Supreme maintains, dissolves and creates all beings while remaining one.

verses.sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते | ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ||
verses.transliteration: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param ucyate | jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ jñāna-gamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam ||
verses.translation: That is the light of all lights, said to be beyond darkness. It is knowledge, the knowable, and the goal of knowledge, seated in the hearts of all.
verses.explanation: The Supreme is the source of all illumination and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः | मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ | mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate ||
verses.translation: Thus the field (body), knowledge and the knowable have been briefly described. My devotees, understanding this, become eligible for My nature.
verses.explanation: Understanding these truths qualifies one for divine realization.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि | विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसंभवान् ||
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api | vikārāṃś ca guṇāṃś caiva viddhi prakṛti-sambhavān ||
verses.translation: Know that both material nature and the living entities are beginningless. Know also that all transformations and qualities are born of material nature.
verses.explanation: The eternal distinction between matter and spirit.

verses.sanskrit: कार्यकरणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते | पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: kārya-karaṇa-kartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate | puruṣaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṃ bhoktṛtve hetur ucyate ||
verses.translation: Material nature is said to be the cause of all material causes and effects, whereas the living entity is the cause of the various sufferings and enjoyments in this world.
verses.explanation: Prakriti is the doer, purusha is the experiencer.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् | कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ||
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ prakṛti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛti-jān guṇān | kāraṇaṃ guṇa-saṅgo 'sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu ||
verses.translation: The living entity in material nature follows the ways of life, enjoying the three modes. This is due to his association with that nature. Thus he meets with good and evil in various births.
verses.explanation: The soul's bondage comes from attachment to material qualities.

verses.sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः | परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ||
verses.transliteration: upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ | paramātmeti cāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ ||
verses.translation: Yet in this body there is another, a transcendental enjoyer who is the Lord, the supreme proprietor, who exists as the overseer and permitter, and who is known as the Supersoul.
verses.explanation: The presence of the Supreme Soul (Paramatma) in each body.

verses.sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ||
verses.transliteration: ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca guṇaiḥ saha | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi na sa bhūyo 'bhijāyate ||
verses.translation: One who understands this philosophy concerning material nature, the living entity and the interaction of the modes of nature is sure to attain liberation. He will not take birth again, regardless of his present position.
verses.explanation: Liberation comes from proper understanding of these truths.

verses.sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना | अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ||
verses.transliteration: dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecid ātmānam ātmanā | anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena cāpare ||
verses.translation: Some perceive the Supersoul within themselves through meditation, others through cultivation of knowledge, and still others through working without fruitive desire.
verses.explanation: Different paths to perceive the Supreme within.

verses.sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते | तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ||
verses.transliteration: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate | te 'pi cātitaranty eva mṛtyuṃ śruti-parāyaṇāḥ ||
verses.translation: Others, not knowing these paths, worship by hearing from others, and they too transcend death by their devotion to what they have heard.
verses.explanation: Even those who follow authority with faith can attain liberation.

verses.sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् | क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: yāvat sañjāyate kiñcit sattvaṃ sthāvara-jaṅgamam | kṣetra-kṣetra-jña-saṃyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: O chief of the Bharatas, whatever being is born, moving or unmoving, know that it is due to the union of the field and the knower of the field.
verses.explanation: All manifestation arises from the interaction of matter and spirit.

verses.sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् | विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ parameśvaram | vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ||
verses.translation: One who sees the supreme Lord dwelling equally in all beings, the imperishable among the perishable, truly sees.
verses.explanation: The perfected vision sees the eternal Lord within all temporal beings.

verses.sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् | न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: samaṃ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram | na hinasty ātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim ||
verses.translation: Seeing the Lord equally present everywhere, one does not degrade himself by his mind. Thus he approaches the transcendental destination.
verses.explanation: Equal vision leads to self-realization and liberation.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः | यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ | yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṃ sa paśyati ||
verses.translation: One who sees that all activities are performed by the body, which is created of material nature, and sees that the self does nothing, actually sees.
verses.explanation: Proper vision understands the soul as non-doer.

verses.sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति | तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा ||
verses.transliteration: yadā bhūta-pṛthag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśyati | tata eva ca vistāraṃ brahma saṃpadyate tadā ||
verses.translation: When a sensible man ceases to see different identities, which are due to different material bodies, he attains to the Brahman conception. Thus he sees that beings are expanded everywhere.
verses.explanation: Transcending bodily distinctions leads to Brahman realization.

verses.sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः | शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||
verses.transliteration: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ | śarīra-stho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate ||
verses.translation: O son of Kunti, the supreme Self, being beginningless and without qualities, does not act nor is affected, although in the body.
verses.explanation: The eternal, transcendental nature of the Supreme Self.

verses.sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते | सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yathā sarva-gataṃ saukṣmyād ākāśaṃ nopalipyate | sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate ||
verses.translation: As the all-pervading space is not tainted because of its subtlety, so the self situated everywhere in the body is not tainted.
verses.explanation: An analogy showing the soul's purity despite bodily contact.

verses.sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः | क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||
verses.transliteration: yathā prakāśayaty ekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokam imaṃ raviḥ | kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata ||
verses.translation: O scion of Bharata, as the sun alone illuminates all this universe, so does the knower of the field (the soul) illuminate the entire field (the body).
verses.explanation: The soul illuminates the body just as the sun illuminates the world.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा | भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-kṣetra-jñayor evam antaraṃ jñāna-cakṣuṣā | bhūta-prakṛti-mokṣaṃ ca ye vidur yānti te param ||
verses.translation: Those who see with eyes of knowledge the difference between the field and the knower of the field, and the liberation of beings from material nature, attain the supreme.
verses.explanation: Final conclusion - discerning spirit from matter leads to liberation.
